summary: This document consists of multiple 30-minute inmate observation check sheets from the Special Housing Unit (SHU) at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) New York, dated August 8, 2019. The sheets record staff checks on inmates in locked-down status, with signatures for each half-hour block. The document is significant as it pertains to the period when Jeffrey Epstein was held at MCC New York prior to his death.

events.title: Inmate Observation Checks at MCC NY SHU
events.description: Routine 30-minute observation checks were conducted on inmates held in the Special Housing Unit (administrative detention or disciplinary segregation) at the Metropolitan Correctional Center, New York.

keyFacts: The document is a set of prison log sheets from the MCC New York Special Housing Unit dated August 8, 2019.
It details a strict protocol requiring staff to observe inmates in locked-down status at least twice per hour, on an irregular schedule.
The sheets are for multiple tiers (ZA Tier-G, H, J, K, L-Tier, ZB), indicating checks across different sections of the SHU.
Each check requires a staff signature, documenting compliance with observation procedures.
The date places this document within the timeframe Jeffrey Epstein was incarcerated at MCC New York before his death on August 10, 2019.
